validationText

restrict: ''

NameTypeDesciption
mm-validator A Enables the directive Has to use on input's parent object, input must to have form level unique name and must use ngModel
can take string or JSONString parameter
if there is only one message you can write it as a string mm-validator="please use a valid email"
if there are multiple validation like required and email mm-validator="{'required':'can not be empty','email':'requires valid email'}"
for multiple validation you can check
  • email
  • max
  • maxlength
  • min
  • minlength
  • number
  • pattern
  • required
  • url
  • date
  • datetimelocal
  • time
  • week
  • monthli>
class dark >darker border color, simple > no border
Know Bugs older IOS devices don't fire invalid event when click to submit it doesn't show validations , Select doesn't fire invalid event
Contact Info 
<form name="validateForm">
  <div class="form-group dark" mm-validator="{'required':'can not be empty'}">
    <label class="control-label">Name</label> <input type="text" class="form-control" name="username" ng-model="name" required />
  </div>
  <div class="form-group simple" mm-validator>
    <label class="control-label">phone</label> <input type="date" class="form-control" name="userphone" ng-model="userphone" />
  </div>
  <div class="form-group" mm-validator="{'required':'can not be empty','email':'requires valid email'}">
    <label class="control-label">e-mail</label> <input type="email" class="form-control" name="useremail" ng-model="emailuser" required />
  </div>
  <input type="submit" value="submit" />
</form>

Example block-level help text here.

<select class="form-control" ng-model="validationText">
    <option value="">None</option>
    <option value="has-warning">has-warning</option>
    <option value="has-error">has-error</option>
    <option value="has-success">has-success</option>
</select>
 
<div class="checkbox"><label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox" ng-model="validationDark" />Dark</label></div>
<div class="checkbox"><label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox" ng-model="ValidationSimple" />Simple</label></div>
<div class="checkbox"><label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox" ng-model="ValidationNone" />Hide the Message</label></div>
<div class="form-group" ng-class="{'has-warning': validationText=='has-warning', 'has-error': validationText=='has-error', 'has-success': validationText=='has-success', 'dark':validationDark==true, 'simple':ValidationSimple==true,'has-none':ValidationNone==true}">
    <label class="control-label" for="inputWarning-4">Input with warning</label>
    <input class="form-control" id="inputWarning-4" type="text">
    <p class="help-block">Example block-level help text here.</p>
</div>
 
for adding manual Validation/Notification functionality  
                    you can pick "None"> Message will be hidden, 
                    has-warning > yellow border on input and yellow background on  help-block 
                    has-error > red border on input and red background on  help-block 
                    has-success > green border on input and green background on  help-block 
                    dark > can work with has-warning, has-error, has-success and make colors darker
                    simple > can work with has-warning, has-error, has-success and hide  help-block's background
